page.title: 05Education
page.content: There are no village schools in this area and most children are taken by bus to the schools in Bromyard, the younger children attending St. Peter's primary and those of secondary age attending the Queen Elizabeth High school. The children take their GCE and/or CSE at this school, and those who wish may then transfer to Hereford where they have the option of attending the sixth form college, the art college, or the technical college. Those who wish to study agriculture attend the college at Holme Lacy, which is about twenty miles away. Some parents chose to send their children to private and fee-paying public schools. Adult education classes are run by the LEA and WEA in Bromyard.
